embeds.title: **COMMAND HELP**
embeds.description: **LCARS**  or "Library Computer Access Retrieval System", uses a command entry interface where you can query our expansive database for specific information. All commands available are listed below.

fields.name: **ENGINEERING**
fields.value:
```asciidoc
!armada         :: Armada location & detailed specs
!badges         :: Information on Officer Badges
!blueprint      :: Where to find Ship blueprint
!hostile        :: Summary/detailed hostile information
!mission        :: List/details & rewards
!nearest        :: Find nearby systems
!officer        :: Officer ability, costs, and more
!parts          :: Information on Ship Parts
!planet         :: Find system(s) by planet name
!refit          :: Ship skins and projectiles
!research       :: Research information
!resource       :: Summary/detailed mining information
!route          :: Path between 2 systems
!scrap          :: Ship rewards and time
!ship           :: Ship information & upgrades
!starbase       :: Starbase upgrade information
!system         :: Summary/detailed system information
!zone           :: Territory zones in Origin Sector
```

fields.name: **ASTROMETRICS**
fields.value:
```asciidoc
!abbreviations  :: List of BOT abbreviations
!alliancelevel  :: Summary/details for Alliance Level
!chart          :: Charts/infographics maintained/tracked
!daily          :: Daily Goals & Milestones
!factionevent   :: Faction event tiers and rewards
!factionlevel   :: Reputation required for each level
!factionmessage :: Faction Message Information
!faq            :: Information on a command or topic
!hello          :: Start Private session
!help           :: This help information
!invite         :: Discord Invite
!plutonium      :: Plutonium location information
!pvplevel       :: Player vs player attack levels
!relocation     :: Where to get Relocation Token
!triangle       :: Describes the battle triangle
```

fields.name: **TEN FORWARD**
fields.value:
```asciidoc
!beer           :: Hear a witty one liner from our bot
!coffee         :: Juice up the Code Monkeys
!quote          :: Random favorite Star Trek quotes
!roa            :: Ferengi Rules of Acquisition
!sleep          :: Tell Code Monkeys to sleep!
!stardate       :: Converts from/to Kelvin stardate
!tea            :: Deliver tea to the boss
!vodka, etc     :: Hear a fun quote
```

fields.name: DETAILED COMMAND HELP
fields.value:
For help with a specific command, use the following:
```
!help command_name 
```
For example, for more information on the Ship command, like modes, filters, etc, use: `!help ship` or you can shorten it to: `!? ship`

== end all commands help ==

embeds.title: ** COMMAND HELP**
embeds.description:
```asciidoc
= Hostile / Armada command =

Summary or detailed hostile or armada information

Command ::
!hostile / !armada

Aliases ::
!hos, !npc / !arm
```

fields.name: Syntax:
fields.value:
```asciidoc
!command <name> <filters> <min> <condition> <max> <sort>

Command ::
 * hostile  - hostile search
 * armada   - armada search

Name ::
 * Full/partial Hostile or armada name
 * enclose in quotes for explicit name search

Filters ::
 * Faction  - Neutral, Fed, Rom, Kln, Aug
              Swarm, Borg, Eclipse, Rogue
 * Hostile  - Interceptor, Explorer, Battleship
              Survey
 * Armada   - Uncommon, Rare, Epic
 * Info     - summary list/detailed stats/info
 * Rank     - Ranked summary stats/info
 * fp       - Ship weapons (firing pattern)
 * Other    - Elite, Hub, Mission, Planet, Warp,
              Power, Reputation, Dark, Deep, Origin
 * FAQ      - Armada frequently Asked Questions

Min/Max ::
 * Numeric filter range
   - level (default)
   - hostile/armada strength/power/rep

Condition ::
 * applied to range: `+`, `=`, `-`, `<`, `>`,
                     `<=`, `>=`
   - only applies to the first range value

 Sort ::
  * `!` sort by Name

```

fields.name: Usage Examples:
fields.value:
```asciidoc
Hostiles ::
!hostile 31              = level 31 hostiles sys view
!hostile 31 info         = level 31 hostiles info view
!host bs 33              = level 33 battleship hostiles
!npc scout 31            = level 31 scouts
!npc fed "scout *" 31    = level 31 fed scouts
!npc fed "scout *" 31 fp = firing pattern
!npc fed "scout *" fp    = all fed scout by level
!npc "Pakled Thief" info = summary of all hostile type
!npc "Pakled Thief" rank = level ranked best to worst

Armadas ::
!armada citadel 36 info  = Romulan Citadel 36 info card
!armada epic fed hubs    = Fed hub systems epic armada
!armada epic fed 33 info = armada stats and information
!armada Origin           = Origin space armada list
!armada faq              = detailed armada information
!borgmadas               = list all Borg armadas
!muddmadas               = list all Outlaw armadas
!anomadas                = list all Anomaly armadas
!terrimadas              = list all Origin Sector armadas
```

 * Hostile types: hos, int, exp, bshp, sur
 * Armada types: unc, rar, epi

embeds.title: **HOW-TO**
embeds.description:
*The following information is courtesy of the [Official STFC Discord](https://discord.gg/6s5dnrg)*

For charts for Armadas by faction, use command: `!armada chart`

fields.name: **How do I get started with Armadas?**
fields.value:
You can earn Armada Tactical Cores through events, from Alliance gifts or you get them from packs in the store.

This will allow you to do the Armadas Control Center (ACC) research and construct it after completing. However once someone in your Alliance has the ACC and can call Armadas, other alliance members can join them, defeat Armada Targets, earn credits, cores and so on. So you only need one person in your Alliance to build the building, and then it will spread!

The following charts have been provided by jwg888, thank you very much!
* https://i.imgur.com/w9C2obO.jpg
* https://i.imgur.com/z5K54iT.jpg

fields.name: **How do I get Armadas Directives?**
fields.value: You can get 100 Directives :directives: a week from the Alliance store, and 15 per day from Daily Goal milestones though these numbers are subject to change. There may also be events and other free sources at various times so stay tuned!

fields.name: **Do Armada Targets belong to their respective Factions?**
fields.value: Yes, Armada Targets that belong to a faction count as being of that faction for abilities, dailies etc.

fields.name: **What are the contents of the Uncommon Armada packs?**
fields.value:
The Uncommon Armada packs can contain:
- Armada Tactical Cores
- Ship XP
- Officer XP
- Repair Speedups
- Ship Parts
- Common and/or Uncommon Materials

There is some randomness however.

fields.name: **How is it decided who gets to participate in an Armada?**
fields.value:
Ships that take part in the attack must have joined the Armada and must be within the Armada Zone when the attack starts.

When those conditions are met, then the following decides the rest:
- One ship belonging to the Armada Leader. (the player who called the Armada)
- One ship per other player, up to the maximum Armada size. (determined by the level of the Armada Leader's Armada Control Center building)

If there are multiple ships, which ones are picked is based on the power/strength of the ships.

The Armada Leader can also select certain joined players to ensure their participation regardless of power/strength.

fields.name: **Can we PvP?**
fields.value: Not yet but rest assured that Armadas PvP is definitely coming!

fields.name: **How do I share the location of an Armada Target?**
fields.value:
Armada Targets themselves register as regular faction hostiles so can't be bookmarked / shared immediately. However once you start an Armada against that target, you'll be able to share the location of where you're forming your Armada.

Good luck and have a great game!!!

fields.name: **Armadas bonus exceptions**
fields.value:
Due to their size and power, Armada Targets are not affected by the following research bonuses and abilities:
• Research: Combat - Defensive Tactics
• B’Rel Class - Cloaking System
• Gladius Class - Secret Weapon
• Grace Chen - Energy Absorber
• T’Laan - Objective Defense
• Tal - Resistance
• Mara - Wife of a Dahar
• Qa’ug - Excel under Pressure
• Severus - Spreading Fire
• Yuki Sulu - Disrupting Field
• John Harrison - Sabotage
• Marlena Moreau - No Fear
• Cadet Nyota Uhura - Scan the Enemy
• Vixis - Fake Communiques
• D’joaki - Shatter Defenses
• Chang - Dogs of War

embeds.title: ** COMMAND HELP**
embeds.description:
```asciidoc
= ship command =

Ship upgrade/repair cost & time by component/tier, total cost of ownership, warp/impulse range/speed, blueprints, firing patterns, capacity & protected cargo, crew slots, and scrapping

Command ::
!ship

Aliases ::
!shp, !sh, !bird
```

fields.name: Syntax:
fields.value:
```asciidoc
!ship <name> <mode> <filters> <sort>
!<name> <mode> <filters> <sort>

Name ::
 * Full/partial/nickname ship name

Mode ::
 * blueprint - cost & where
 * cargo     - protected/capacity by tier
 * crewslots - # of crew by level
 * crewstats - crew stat bonus
 * firingpattern - ship weapon firing pattern (fp)
 * stats   - ship statistics
 * info    - Tier + component
 * levels  - XP by tier
 * repair  - cost by tier
 * scrap   - requires level and tier
 * warp    - warp/impulse range/speed by tier
 * cost    - search in field
 * list    - compact list of ship by
               faction/type/rarity/grade

Filters ::
 * tier    - ship or Component tier/mk
 * faction - neutral, federation, romulan, klingon
 * grade   - G1 to G4 / 1* to 4*
 * rarity  - common, uncommon, rare, epic
 * tco     - total cost of ownership
 * type    - interceptor, explorer, battleship,
               survey
Sort ::
 * byFaction, byGrade, byRarity, byType
```

fields.name: Usage Examples:
fields.value:
```asciidoc
!ship byfaction     = list sorted by faction
!ship list          = compact list of all ships
!ship list byRarity = list sorted by rarity
!ship g4            = all G4 ships
!ship fed           = all federation ships
!envoy T5           = ECS Envoy Tier 5 total costs
!bortas T5 T9       = Bortas total cost Tiers 5 to 9
!cent T5 warp       = Centurion MK5 warp engine cost
!cent lvls          = XP by level - all tiers
!pizza cutter repair  = Saladin repair cost/tier
!mf warp            = Mayflower Warp and impulse
!scrap list         = list of scrappable ships
!scrap fed 3*       = Fed 3* recyclable ships
!intrepid scrap T9 45 = Recycle Lvl 45 ship, T9
           components reward Resources + base time
!augur stats        = Augur T1 stats sunmmary
!augur stats t7     = Augur T7 stats summary
!augur stats t7 36  = Ops 36 specific details
!ship cost          = list of all cost resources
!4* rare ship "rare ore" cost
    = list by "rare ore" costs for Rare G4 ships

```

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value:
```
 * Part/Components: armor, cargo, impulse engine,
                    mining laser, shield, warp
                    engine, weapon, energy, kinetic
 * Total per tier: All Components + Tier upgrade
    eg: T5 = upgrade all MK4 to MK5 + tier 5

 ** For Skins and Projectiles, see !refit help
```

embeds.title: **FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQ)**
embeds.description:
```asciidoc
armada ::
 How-to

ascension, ascend ::
 How to obtain the Ascend keys

badges ::
 Officer Badges

burning ::
 Burning Definition

dpr ::
 Damage Per Round Definition

factionlevels, faction, fac, fl, reputation, rep ::
 Dual-Faction Reputation

factionmessages, fm ::
 Acquiring Faction Messages

hullbreach, hb ::
 Hull Breach Definition

mitigation ::
 Mitigation Definition

morale ::
 Morale Definition

nap ::
 Non-Aggreesion Pact Definition

parts ::
 Battleships, Explorers, Interceptors, Surveys

research, res, r ::
 How to Calculate Time & Cost Reductions

roe ::
 Rules Of Engagement Definition

scrapyard ::
 Scrapping ships how-to

starbase, base, sb, station, stn, upgrade, upg ::
 How to Calculate Time & Cost Reductions

Syntax::
 !faq <keyword>
 !<keyword> faq

Usage Examples::
 !faq armada
 !armada faq

Notes::
 More FAQs coming soon!

```

embeds.title: **MITIGATION DEFINITION**
embeds.description:
**Mitigation** is the action of reducing the severity of attacks.

Defense values (armor, shield deflection, dodge) and piercing values (armor piercing, shield piercing, accuracy) are all used to determine damage mitigation. The higher your defense values, the more damage you mitigate.

The exact details are described at https://stfc-toolbox.vercel.app/mitigation

embeds.title: **HULL BREACH DEFINITION**
embeds.description:
**Hull Breach** increases critical damage taken by the target (your critical hits will be 50% bigger if the enemy has **Hull Breach**)

**Hull Breach** effect attaches to the target, and thus is shared in a fleet fight (armadas or station defense).
